thread.title: BlueJays outlast Cardinals in wild JV game
thread.title_full: BlueJays outlast Cardinals in wild JV game

title: BlueJays outlast Cardinals in wild JV game
text:
BlueJays outlast Cardinals in wild JV game Published: Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 11:12 a.m. CDT • Updated: Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 12:16 p.m. CDT Caption (Jocelyn Sheets/Daily News) Jaron Roush (28) takes the handoff from Newton High quarterback Reagan Maple as Jordan Norvell (21) goes the opposite direction on a running play. Roush rushed for 185 yards and scored five rushing touchdowns, one receiving touchdown and two two-point conversions in the Newton junior varsity’s 64-55 loss Monday at home against Bondurant-Farrar. By Jocelyn Sheets Newton Daily News 
Scoring 55 points should win a football game for a team. Newton High’s junior varsity scored 55 points Monday in its season finale at home against Bondurant-Farrar. 
Unfortunately, the visiting BlueJays piled up 64 points to win a wild offensive contest, 64-55. 
Bondurant-Farrar had more than 500 yards of total offense while Newton had 463 yards. 
Newton trailed 22-8 after one quarter and down 38-36 at halftime. 
Going into the fourth quarter, the Cardinals trailed the BlueJays, 58-43. 
Jaron Roush scored five rushing touchdowns on runs of 4, 3, 40, 4 and 25 yards. He caught a 16-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Reagan Maple. Roush scored two two-point conversions. 
Roush had two kickoff returns of 76 and 70 yards to set up the Cardinals in great field position. 
Roush finished with 185 yards on 24 carries, but was not Newton’s leading rusher. 
Josh Miravalles rolled up 253 yards on 19 carries for the Cardinals. Miravalles scored touchdowns on 14 yards and 9 yards. 
Zach Combs executed two onside kicks recovered by Newton to lead to touchdowns. Combs was 3-for-3 on extra-point attempts. 
Grant Garvis blocked a BlueJay punt and recovered two Bondurant-Farrar fumbles for Newton’s defense. Garvis, Joe Busch and Trevor Ergenbright led the defensive effort by the Cardinals. 
The Cardinal junior varsity finished at 2-5 for the season.
